intro: Tristellateia heterophylla, commonly known as the variable-leaf starwort, is a flowering plant native to South America. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant exhibits morphological variation in its leaves, which can be either entire or lobed, depending on environmental conditions. It typically grows in wetlands and marshy areas, thriving in moist, nutrient-rich soils. Tristellateia heterophylla is often found in regions with temperate to subtropical climates.
